sentences.english: The independent instigator is namely what is regarded as "attempted instigation" acceptedly by ChineseForeign traditional theory of criminal law.
sentences.chinese: 对独立教唆犯，中外刑法理论上称之为“教唆未遂”。

sentences.english: The independent instigator is namely what is regarded as "attempted instigation" acceptedly by ChineseForeign traditional theory of criminal law.
sentences.chinese: 对独立教唆犯，中外刑法理论上称之为“教唆未遂”。

sentences.english: Article 53 Whoever instigates a minor to break law or commit criminal offences shall be given heavier punishment according to law .
sentences.chinese: 第五十三条教唆未成年人违法犯罪的，依法从重处罚。

sentences.english: One who instigates a person under the age of eighteen to commit a crime shall be given a heavier punishment.
sentences.chinese: 教唆不满十八周岁的人犯罪的，应当从重处罚。

sentences.english: Because of the smell of solicitation in the air, and because we are usually in the middle of it.
sentences.chinese: 而是由于不厌其烦的教唆，而且我们经常置身于其中。

sentences.english: The fetus survived, but she was charged with criminal solicitation to commit murder.
sentences.chinese: 胎儿还是保住了，但是她被控教唆他人实施谋杀。

sentences.english: That is far from aiding and abetting copyright infringement.
sentences.chinese: 这是远离协助及教唆他人侵犯版权。

sentences.english: Anyone who instigates a person under the age of 18 to commit a crime shall be given a heavier punishment.
sentences.chinese: 教唆不满十八周岁的人犯罪的，应当从重处罚。

sentences.english: And thus for wider carnage taught to pant.
sentences.chinese: 如此教唆残杀，直到气喘咻咻。

sentences.english: Some Chinese professors actually teach their students to plagiarize.
sentences.chinese: “实际上，正是一些中国教授教唆他们的学生剽窃”。

sentences.english: The man is arrest for his seducement of children into using drug.
sentences.chinese: 这个男人因为教唆儿童用毒品而被逮捕。

sentences.english: At the same time, Liu also believe that the Iraqi declaration, only to be abetting .
sentences.chinese: 同时，大刘亦相信伊人这次的声明，只是受人教唆。

sentences.english: Third, I think some of the protests are really led by Luddites.
sentences.chinese: 再次，我认为有些反对者的确被勒德分子所教唆。

sentences.english: The second section is concerned with joint crime theory related to the instigator in Civil Law.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分大陆法系有关教唆犯的共同犯罪理论。

sentences.english: Her husband was found guilty of aiding and abetting the offence.
sentences.chinese: 她丈夫被裁定一项教唆罪成。

sentences.english: He was scolded for aiding and abetting those boys who were fighting.
sentences.chinese: 他因为教唆这些打群架的孩子而受到责备。

definition: to entrap/to frame/to plant false evidence against sb
to instigate/to incite/to egg sb on
to incite/to prompt (sb to do sth)
variant of 污衊|污蔑[wu1 mie4]
to entrap/to set up/to frame (up)/to make false charges against
to start rumours and create trouble
to conspire to murder/to plot against sb's life
